title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

sdumitriu - (03:09): Good morning

Denis joined #xwiki at 06:09

plunden1 joined #xwiki at 08:30

headache - (08:57): good morning  
npm left at 08:58 (Quit: Leaving.  
npm joined #xwiki at 09:01  
silviar joined #xwiki at 09:15  
nuvolari joined #xwiki at 09:20  
nuvolari - (09:21): hello, is it possible to embed a google docs calendar using the GoogleCalendar Macro ?\  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 09:25  
daning joined #xwiki at 09:26  
vmassol - (09:42): good morning  
vmassol - (09:43): I'm going to stop myxwiki to try to install bblfish's jars  
bblfish - (09:43): cool ! I am here for help  
vmassol - (09:44): bblfish: so I take the 2 jars from http://bblfish.net/tmp/2010/02/xwiki/ right?  
bblfish - (09:44): yes, and then install one war  
bblfish - (09:44): xar  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 09:45  
bblfish - (09:46): then there is the last point of the README http://github.com/bblfish/keygenapp/tree/master/xwiki/  
vmassol - (09:46): I'm jsut instaling the jars  
bblfish - (09:46): well point 4  
vmassol - (09:46): for now  
bblfish - (09:46): ok  
vmassol - (09:46): you can do the rest I think  
vmassol - (09:46): (I'll give you access to incubator)  
bblfish - (09:47): ok  
evalica joined #xwiki at 09:52  
vmassol - (09:53): ok restarted  
vmassol - (09:54): sdumitriu: I'm looking at the permissions and groups on incubator and I need some help  
vmassol - (09:55): there are a few things I don't understand  
vmassol - (09:56): 1) why is there a xwiki sas group on myxwiki.org ? (since this is a community farm I don't think we should see that). We do need a contributor or committer group though, I think contributor is better than committer since it's more generic and we have contributors who might need access to incubator without being committers, wdyt?  
vmassol - (09:56): 2) there's a BadXWikisasgroup on incubator which is also strange  
vmassol - (09:56): 3) there's a balsamiqmockupeditors group. Shouldn't we merge this with a single contributor group as mentioned in point 1) ?  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 09:57  
sdumitriu - (09:58): 1 and 2 yes  
sdumitriu - (09:58): 3, I don't know  
vmassol - (09:58): ok we can leave the balsamiq grou  
vmassol - (09:58): if we want to restrict to a space for ex  
daning left at 09:58 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
daning joined #xwiki at 09:59  
vmassol - (09:59): (the mockup space)  
vmassol - (09:59): sdumitriu: now the other question is: what rights do we give to contributors? edit rights?  
vmassol - (09:59): what about admin rights for importing xars? should we keep this to admins only?  
vmassol - (10:00): (in this case I'll do the import for bblfish)  
vmassol - (10:00): it's probably better not to have too many people admins actually  
sdumitriu - (10:02): +1  
vmassol - (10:03): btw the add user to group has a display bug  
vmassol - (10:03): on incubator  
vmassol - (10:03): when you add someone it doesn't appear in the list (when in the lightbox)  
vmassol - (10:03): maybe it's becuase we haven't updated the xar  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 10:09  
vmassol - (10:11): bblfish: what is the link to the XAR I should import?  
bblfish - (10:11): ah you have to refresh the page I think  
vmassol - (10:11): bblfish: you have now edit rights on incubator, use with care ;) (but you don't have admin rights)  
vmassol - (10:12): what page?  
bblfish - (10:12): your home page  
vmassol - (10:12): ah yes  
bblfish - (10:12): it certainly needs a bit of work on the UI side  
bblfish - (10:13): a bit of Ajax to change the list of certs would be useful. But I am not an ajax person.  
vmassol - (10:13): bblfish: ok done  
vmassol - (10:13): it's all your now  
vmassol - (10:13): s/your/yours/  
bblfish - (10:13): ok. It's a one liner  
bblfish - (10:15): vmassol I don't think I have rights to edit http://myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/XWikiUserProfileSheet  
bblfish - (10:16): did the war get uploaded to the WebId namespace?  
tmortagne - (10:16): vmassol: re group UI, it's a bug I reported recently and that has been fixed if i remember well so it probably needs an import yes  
vmassol - (10:17): yes  
bblfish - (10:17): I can'f find http://myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/WebId/CreateCert  
vmassol - (10:17): tmortagne: ok thanks  
vmassol - (10:17): it's on incubator bblfish  
vmassol - (10:17): incubator.myxwiki.org/...  
bblfish - (10:17): ah ok  
KermitTheFragger joined #xwiki at 10:17  
vmassol - (10:17): this is a farm with lots of wikis  
vmassol - (10:18): (close to 100 wikis)  
vmassol - (10:18): incubator is one of them  
bblfish - (10:21): ah ok. so I would need to edit http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/XWikiUserSheet  
bblfish - (10:22): Edit XWiki.XWikiUserSheet so that the call to XWiki.XWikiUserProfileSheet is replaced by WebId.XWikiUserProfileSheet  
vmassol - (10:23): bblfish: cannot you do this only for your user?  
vmassol - (10:23): or for users who want this feature?  
vmassol - (10:23): (not sure)  
vmassol - (10:23): unless it's harmless  
bblfish - (10:23): well the interesting things is to create a community of users  
bblfish - (10:24): it's harmless. It gives them an rdfa profile page, and allows them to create keys  
vmassol - (10:24): I'm jsut worried  
vmassol - (10:24): that we're going to lose any change we brought to xwikiuserprogfilesheet in the future  
bblfish - (10:24): well then we would need to integrate it into xwikiuserprofilesheet  
bblfish - (10:25): somehow we have to first allow people to try it out  
vmassol - (10:25): actually  
tmortagne - (10:25): or have some extension point for it  
vmassol - (10:25): a good idea would be to add a user profile tab for this  
vmassol - (10:25): I don't know how extensible the tabs are jvdrean  
vmassol - (10:26): can a tab be located in another document for example?  
bblfish - (10:26): so the html is marked up in rdfa  
vmassol - (10:26): can it be discovered?  
vmassol - (10:26): ah  
bblfish - (10:26): that should remain  
bblfish - (10:26): I can certainly move the form to create the key somewhere else  
vmassol - (10:26): there's the rdfa stuff indeed but that could be in another tab right?  
vmassol - (10:26): all you need is a URL that points to a page with the rdfa tags  
bblfish - (10:26): the RDFa should be in the profile page really  
vmassol - (10:26): right?  
bblfish - (10:26): yes  
bblfish - (10:27): but it makes sense to have it in the profile page  
bblfish - (10:27): in the user's home page  
bblfish - (10:27): that is what is also going to be his OpenId  
vmassol - (10:27): it would be on the profile page but not in the first tab  
tmortagne left at 10:28 (Quit: Leaving.  
bblfish - (10:28): Well I think the RDFa markup is not visible to the user  
bblfish - (10:28): the public keys can be in a different tab yes  
bblfish - (10:28): that makes sense  
vmassol - (10:29): It all depends if we consider your stuff as core stuff or as extension  
vmassol - (10:29): right now I'm tempted to consider it as extension  
bblfish - (10:29): well to find that out we have to play with it :-)  
vmassol - (10:29): since not everyone might need/want it in his own wiki  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 10:29  
vmassol - (10:29): especially for internal company wikis  
vmassol - (10:29): (who don't know anything about rdf)  
vmassol - (10:29): so extensions sounds best for now to me  
bblfish - (10:30): yes.  
bblfish - (10:30): well perhaps this should be tied together with another tool that gives people nice URIs  
bblfish - (10:30): so that the home page/openid become xwiki.org/p/bblfish  
bblfish - (10:31): if people want that, then it's likely they are 1. on the web 2. interested in identity  
vmassol - (10:31): bblfish: FTM it would be http://www.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/VincentMassol?category=foaf or something like that  
vmassol - (10:31): (tcategory is the id for the tab)  
vmassol - (10:32): then you can use a short url service on the web to make it shorter  
bblfish - (10:32): yes for WebId's it does not matter how ugly the WebId is, as the user does not need to see it  
vmassol - (10:32): till we have such a service built in  
bblfish - (10:32): it's easy to change, as it's all velocity  
vmassol - (10:33): jvdrean: you there?  
jvdrean - (10:33): vmassol: yes  
vmassol - (10:33): how extensible are the profile categories?  
vmassol - (10:33): are they hardcoded right now?  
vmassol - (10:34): or can I dynamically add a page with a category object ?  
jvdrean - (10:34): yes they are hardcoded  
vmassol - (10:34): ok  
jvdrean - (10:34): it's easy to add a tab though  
daning left at 10:34 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
vmassol - (10:34): jvdrean: you have a plan for having extension points?  
vmassol - (10:35): jvdrean: the need is to add a tab without touching the page  
vmassol - (10:35): (otherwise you need to perform a manual merge whenever you reimport the default XAR)  
vmassol - (10:36): so this can be done either through IX or through custom Objects  
vmassol - (10:36): the mythical IX :)  
jvdrean - (10:36): I have no precise plan, it could be done with both methods  
jvdrean - (10:36): I wanted to make a proposal with objects but I missed time  
vmassol - (10:36): ok  
bblfish - (10:39): vmassol: you could do the change now, tell people to use it, and ask for feedback and ideas  
vmassol - (10:39): bblfish: what change?  
bblfish - (10:39): I suppose that is what the incubator is for  
vmassol - (10:39): the pb is that people need local users for this to work  
bblfish - (10:39): replacing the user sheet with mine  
vmassol - (10:40): we're all using farm users  
bblfish - (10:40): local users?  
vmassol - (10:40): bblfish: I think you'll need to send a mail to the list  
bblfish - (10:40): ah I see  
vmassol - (10:41): explaining what is setup  
vmassol - (10:41): how to use it  
vmassol - (10:41): and the advantages it brings  
vmassol - (10:41): to motivate people  
bblfish - (10:41): the profile is on myxwiki.org  
vmassol - (10:41): I'm checking the rights on incubator for creating local users  
vmassol - (10:42): right now only admins can create local users  
bblfish - (10:42): ok, I thought incubator was a full thing by itself  
vmassol - (10:42): but we do have 21 local users already  
vmassol - (10:42): so that's good already  
vmassol - (10:42): but incubator is a close wiki  
bblfish - (10:43): closed?  
bblfish - (10:43): close?  
vmassol - (10:43): so we'd only address xwiki contributors who have admin rights on incubator  
vmassol - (10:43): closed?  
vmassol - (10:43): s/closed?/closed/  
bblfish - (10:43): ok  
vmassol - (10:43): the pb is your experiment is an open experiment  
vmassol - (10:44): hmm  
vmassol - (10:44): we could create a subwiki for this  
vmassol - (10:44): just for this I mean  
vmassol - (10:44): it's easy to do  
vmassol - (10:44): and we'd leave it open for registration  
vmassol - (10:44): bblfish: what do you think about bblfish.myxwiki.org?  
bblfish - (10:45): rather webid.myxwiki.org  
vmassol - (10:45): ok  
vmassol - (10:45): was thinking you could use it for other stuff  
vmassol - (10:45): but ok fine for webid  
vmassol - (10:45): creating it  
bblfish - (10:45): well with bblfish  
bblfish - (10:45): it's a bit personal  
bblfish - (10:47): but otherwise the tab solution would do too  
vmassol - (10:47): but it's different  
vmassol - (10:47): here the pb is that incubator is not open for registrzation  
vmassol - (10:47): registration  
vmassol - (10:48): so users cannot try your work  
bblfish - (10:48): ah yes  
vmassol - (10:48): give me 1 mn  
vmassol - (10:48): and you'll have your own wiki :)  
vmassol - (10:50): bblfish: done: http://webid.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/  
vmassol - (10:50): you're the owner so you have all rights  
vmassol - (10:50): you can edit anything  
vmassol - (10:50): you can modify the home page to explain the experiment we're doing  
vmassol - (10:50): modify the profile sheet  
vmassol - (10:50): etc  
bblfish - (10:51): ok  
vmassol - (10:51): then you could send a mail on the users/devs list to explain the experiment and what users can do with it maybe?  
vmassol - (10:51): then we can tweet about it, blog it, etc :)  
bblfish - (10:51): yes. ok. good idea  
vmassol - (10:51): invite people to try it  
vmassol - (10:51): you can change the color theme to suite your taste too ;)  
lucaa left at 10:55 (Quit: Leaving.  
anamarias joined #xwiki at 10:59  
bblfish - (11:19): how do I get my profile on webid.xwiki.org to be on  webid.xiwki.org and not on xwiki.org?  
bblfish - (11:22): ah ok, I have to logout and create a new account  
florinciu left at 11:28 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 11:33  
mflorea left at 11:40 (Quit: Leaving.  
vmassol - (12:05): bblfish: you need to register on webid.xwiki.org  
vmassol - (12:05): so log out and click register there  
bblfish - (12:05): done  
vmassol - (12:06): then you log in with that new local user  
bblfish - (12:07): thanks  
bblfish - (12:07): yes  
bblfish - (12:13): vmassol: you can create yourself an account an try it out too now. Just fixed a few little style and rdfa problems  
anamarias - (12:20): tmortagne: hi  
anamarias - (12:20): I want to add thumbnail and screenshot support for macros  
anamarias - (12:20): For the Wiki Macros it's easy, I create another property for the XWiki.WikiMacroClass, which will have the image URL as its value (external URL or attachment on wiki)  
anamarias - (12:20): But what about the Java Macros? I mean for external URLs there's no problem, but what if you want the image to be packaged together with the macro? Would putting the image in the src/main/resources/ dir will solve it?  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 12:22  
tmortagne - (12:23): anamarias: don't know, tahre is no support for it yet  
anamarias - (12:23): no support for what exactly ?  
anamarias - (12:24): getting the image from local source?  
tmortagne - (12:24): target a resource image in a macro jar resources  
xipe left at 12:24 (Quit: leaving  
tmortagne - (12:25): or for a componenet in general  
xipe joined #xwiki at 12:25  
anamarias - (12:25): and is it difficult?  
tmortagne - (12:25): the problem is not really a macro api issue but how do we reference a resource in a component  
tmortagne - (12:25): no idea  
tmortagne - (12:26): never had to think about it yet :)  
tmortagne - (12:26): (and don't really have time right now)  
anamarias - (12:26): where can I see about \*how do we reference a resource in a component\* ?  
anamarias - (12:27): code that handles that, if it exists that is  
tmortagne - (12:27): well nowhere since we did not done it yet  
mflorea left at 12:27 (Quit: Leaving.  
tmortagne - (12:28): what you could do for now in the macro descriptor api is to return a org.xwiki.rendering.listener.Image  
tmortagne - (12:29): that already support DocumentImage (an image in an attachement) and URLImage  
tmortagne - (12:29): then we will need to add another Image that support image from jar somewhay  
anamarias - (12:30): and these actual images referenced by the listerner.Image where are they located?  
anamarias - (12:30): i mean the actual jpeg  
nickless joined #xwiki at 12:30  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 12:31  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 12:35  
tmortagne - (12:35): as i just aid: DocumentImage (an image in an attachement) and URLImage name speaks for itself  
tmortagne - (12:35): s/aid/said/  
tmortagne - (12:36): the either we add a ResourceImage or we reuse  URLImage with an URL that targets a resource file  
anamarias - (12:37): so a wiki page attachment  
tmortagne - (12:37): yes  
anamarias - (12:37): ok  
jvdrean left at 12:41 (Quit: Leaving.  
MichelleShi joined #xwiki at 12:54  
MichelleShi - (12:54): hi headache  
headache - (12:55): hi MichelleShi  
mflorea - (12:57): vmassol: I have some HQLs that extract stats from an XE instance. I'd like to push them to xwiki.org but I don't know where eactly. I could add them to the http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/velocityHqlExamples or as code snippet on code.xwiki.org. wdyt?  
vmassol - (12:58): mflorea: yes http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/velocityHqlExamples looks good for now  
mflorea - (12:58): ok, thanks  
vmassol - (12:59): (actually having copy snippets and aggregating velocity code snippets in http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/velocityHqlExamples would be nice probably)  
mflorea - (13:00): you mean publish them to code.xwiki.org and then link from velocity HQL examples?  
vmassol - (13:00): or autodiscover them  
mflorea - (13:00): I see  
vmassol - (13:00): we might miss a snippet type in the snippet object though  
vmassol - (13:00): and it would require description field, etc, so there's a bit of work  
vmassol - (13:00): or  
vmassol - (13:01): we could simply move all velocity snippets to code.xwiki.org  
vmassol - (13:01): and make http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/velocityHqlExamples minimal  
mflorea - (13:01): some are really simple  
vmassol - (13:01): and link to the code snippets  
vmassol - (13:01): yes the real simpe ones could stay  
mflorea - (13:01): ok  
vmassol - (13:01): and only more elaborate ones moved  
vmassol - (13:02): but a link from http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/velocityHqlExamples to the snippets space would be nice indded (if it's not already there)  
vmassol - (13:02): (for more elaborate examples)  
mflorea - (13:02): yes  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 13:14  
glerouge joined #xwiki at 13:26  
florinciu left at 13:29 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
headache - (13:39): re  
plunden1 left #xwiki at 14:26  
bblfish - (14:30): So http://webid.myxwiki.org/ has the simplest part of WebIds done  
savi joined #xwiki at 14:30  
glerouge left at 14:48 (Quit: Leaving.

savi left at 14:57 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds  
savi\_ is now known as savi ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
Enygma` left at 14:57 (Quit: Leaving.  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 15:01  
savi left at 15:10 (Quit: savi  
glerouge joined #xwiki at 15:13  
plunden left at 15:21 (Read error: Operation timed out  
florinciu left at 15:29 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:30): Good morning (or afternoon...)  
vmassol - (15:33): hi CalebJamesDeLisl  
xenon75 joined #xwiki at 15:40  
xenon75 is now known as fmancinelli ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
lucaa - (15:41): hi fmancinelli, I have the following situation  
lucaa - (15:41): with some REST services  
lucaa - (15:41): I have an @GET method  
lucaa - (15:43): and I need to parse some sort of request object from its query fields.  
lucaa - (15:43): I wrote a MessageBodyReader<AnnotationRequest> for the type and added AnnotationRequest as a parameter to the @GET method  
lucaa - (15:43): now, everything's working fine  
lucaa - (15:44): but I was reading the jax-rs documentation and it says there that:  
lucaa - (15:44): "The value of a non-annotated parameter, called the entity parameter, is mapped from the request entity body. 20  
lucaa - (15:44): Conversion between an entity body and a Java type is the responsibility of an entity provider, see section 21  
lucaa - (15:44): 4.2."  
lucaa - (15:46): I was wondering, am I just lucky that my MessageBodyReader also works for a @GET method, which doesn't really have a body, or is it supposed to work like this?  
anamarias\_ joined #xwiki at 15:46  
lucaa - (15:46): the get \_request\_ doesn't really have a body, I meant, not the method  
anamarias left at 15:47 (Read error: Operation timed out  
anamarias\_ is now known as anamarias ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
fmancinelli - (15:48): lucaa: well there's something going on there. The best way to see what's going on is to monitor HTTP requests to check what is actually sent… Btw, what's the URI you're GETting?  
lucaa - (15:50): well, my reader falls back on the HttpRequest parameters if there is no body (I've found this technique somewhere in the xwiki-core-rest), so that's how it ends up parsing the query right from the query parameters  
lucaa - (15:51): but my question was rather why exactly is it calling a messagebodyreader to prepare the @Get method parameters. It's good for me, it does the job, but I was just wondering how realiable this is  
fmancinelli - (15:56): lucaa: Well, I don't have a precise answer because this is something that happens behind the RESTlet scenes so if it works it should be ok. Maybe the query parameters are made available seamlessly to the code you wrote in your reader (i.e., query parameters + form urlencoded parameters are accessed in a uniform way through the api)  
fmancinelli - (16:01): lucaa: I mean, since you don't have a body in the GET request, the values you put into your AnnotationRequest object have to come from the URI parameters  
lucaa - (16:01): yes they do, I do parse them from there  
lucaa - (16:01): (04:51:55 PM) lucaa: well, my reader falls back on the HttpRequest parameters if there is no body (I've found this technique somewhere in the xwiki-core-rest), so that's how it ends up parsing the query right from the query parameters  
lucaa - (16:02): the only thing I'm slightly worried about is the actual call of the reader before the @get method  
arkub joined #xwiki at 16:03  
fmancinelli - (16:04): lucaa: why?  
lucaa - (16:05): because a @get request doesn't have a body (well, has a void body) and the reader is supposed to read a body  
lucaa - (16:06): however, if I can use the @get annotation for a method with a non-annotated parameter, I assume the reader is the one to build that parameter...  
lucaa - (16:06): what i'm wondering is if it's the standard or just the restlet impl we're using...  
fmancinelli - (16:07): lucaa: The reader is called because you put a non-annotated parameter in the @GET method. If you remove that and you use @QueryParam annotated parameters, you will be able to retrieve the query parameters and avoid to call the reader.  
jvelociter - (16:08): vmassol: tmortagne I've been surprise to see that newly created document generate a "DocumentSaveEvent" and not a "DocumentCreatedEvent"  
jvelociter - (16:08): I don't understand the wording choice  
lucaa - (16:08): I know I know, so as long as I can put a non-annotated param for the @get, I guess it's fine and it's not implementation dependant  
vmassol - (16:08): jvelociter: me neither  
tmortagne - (16:08): jvdrean: there is no such things as DocumentCreatedEvent and you should ask sdumitriu i did not defined the first events ;)

tmortagne - (16:44): mflorea: macro name are case sensitive mainly because nothing as been decided for it i think  
mflorea - (16:44): ok  
tmortagne - (16:44): but for macro parameters it's done on purpose yes  
mflorea - (16:45): yes, for macro parameter names I know, because I implemented it on the editor side  
mflorea - (16:45): and we discussed about it  
tmortagne - (16:45): now it make sense to do the same with macro name  
mflorea - (16:46): yes, to be consistent. we either enforce case sensitive everywhere or nowhere  
tmortagne - (16:48): there is a difference for macro name  
tmortagne - (16:48): because it's supposed to be also the role hint of the macro  
tmortagne - (16:48): and role hint are case sensitive  
mflorea - (16:50): yes  
mflorea - (16:52): I prefer case sensitive everywhere, but I understand that regular users might find it difficult.  
mflorea - (16:52): even for parameter names, I mean  
tmortagne - (16:52): yes it's too difficult for parameters

tmortagne - (16:53): (well it's not taht it's difficult but that it's a pain)  
tmortagne - (16:54): in macro name it's ok because we usually never use upper case in role hint anyway so all macros are generally lower case  
tmortagne - (16:55): main probleme with parameter is that in java macro they are generated from java methods names
